chapter.title: General structure and usage
chapter.p: The topmost structural units of the library are headers and the library file (or archive) - lib__vic.a or __vic.lib. All the headers are located in the __vic/ subdirectory. One should include them like this:
Where header.h is a name of the desired header.
Almost all the code is placed within __vic namespace, including other namespaces.
During program linking, the library file must be given to the linker. Example:

The library has 2 modes: C++11 mode and C++98 mode. Features available only in C++11 mode are marked with C++11 sign. Features available only in C++98 mode are marked with C++98 sign, respectively. Also in C++98 mode the library file has slightly different name:
chapter.note: C++11 mode is used for C++14/17 as well.
chapter.p: Detailed description of the library components provided in subsequent chapters. Descriptions are grouped by headers. Mainly C++11 language syntax is used as more complete and expressive.
